required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Echocardiographic Study of a Single Dose Bisoprolol Versus Nebivolol in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Echocardiographic Study of a Single Dose Bisoprolol Versus Nebivolol in Healthy Subjects: a Randomized, Double-blind, Cross-over Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, double-blind, crossover study in healthy adult subjects. Each subject will receive a single dose of bisoprolol 5 mg p.o. and nebivolol 5 mg p.o. with 1 week washout period. All subjects will undergo a physical examination, 12-lead electrocardiography and a comprehensive echocardiographic study before the administration of the study drug and 5 hours thereafter.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
primary_outcome.description: CO (l/min), will be assessed by calculating stroke volume using pulsed-wave doppler (velocity time integral)

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes of left ventricular ejection fraction (%)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Ejection fraction will be measured using modified Simpson rule

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes of global longitudinal strain (%)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Global longitudinal strain will be assessed using speckle tracking echocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes of myocardial work (%)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Myocardial work will be assessed by using a dedicated commercially available software (GE, Norway)

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes of atrial function (ml)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Atrial function will be assessed by measuring phasic volume changes during diastole

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Myocardial dispersion will be assessed by using speckle tracking echocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes of TAPSE (tricuspid annular plane systolic excursion, mm)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: TAPSE will be assessed by M-mode echocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes of blood pressure (mmHg)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Brachial blood pressure will be measured by sphygmomanometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes in atrial strain (%)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Atrial strain will be assessed using speckle tracking echocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes of electrical dispersion (ms)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Electrical dispersion will be assessed by using 12-lead electrocardiogram

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes of right ventricular fractional area change (%)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: The parameter will be assessed by two-dimensional echocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes of heart rate (bpm)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate will be measured by 12-lead electrocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes of left ventricular twist (%)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Twist will be assessed by speckle tracking echocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes of QTc interval (ms)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: QTc interval will be measured by using 12-lead electrocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes of mitral E/A ratio (%)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: E/A ratio will be assessed by pulsed-wave Doppler

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative change of mitral E/e prime ratio (%)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: E/e prime ratio will be assessed by pulsed-wave and tissue Doppler echocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative change of mitral E-wave deceleration time (ms)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: E-wave deceleration time will be measured by pulsed-wave Doppler echocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and relative changes of right ventricular global longitudinal strain (%)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and 5 hours post study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Global strain will be assessed by using speckle tracking echocardiography

arm_group.description: In this arm, patient will first receive bisoprolol, and after 1 week washout period, nebivolol
In this arm, patient will first receive nebivolol, and after 1 week washout period, bisoprolol

intervention.description: All subjects will receive both drugs, but at different time periods determined by randomization, with 1 week washout period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Healthy subjects (male and female)
2. Age interval: 20-60 years old (inclusive)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any known absolute or relative contraindication to beta-blocker therapy
2. Poor echogenicity
3. A resting heart rate <60 bpm
4. A resting blood pressure < 110/70 mmHg
